sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 卫国抗敌是每个士兵应尽的光荣职责。

sentences.english: Mr Tait also acted as the official photographer.
sentences.chinese: 泰特先生还担当了官方摄影师的职责。

sentences.english: Only in this way ca fantastic I finish the work intime.
sentences.chinese: 唯有这样我智力及时完成职责。

sentences.english: To learn more about Carrefour's mission and Sales Manager responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 更多地了解我公司的使命和课长的职责。

sentences.english: The Bartender's primary function involves serving alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to guests of the Resort.
sentences.chinese: 吧员的主要职责是为客人提供含酒精和不含酒精饮料。

sentences.english: Every monitor must carry out the invigilating responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 每个监考员必须履行监考职责。

sentences.english: It is a charge to keep and I will give it my all.
sentences.chinese: 它是一项要履行的职责，我将为此鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: The power to interpret the present Supplementary Provisions shall remain with the Ministry of Construction and the Ministry of Commerce.
sentences.chinese: 本补充规定由建设部和商务部按照各自职责负责解释。

sentences.english: B: Because I have other obligations.
sentences.chinese: 因为我还有另外的职责。

sentences.english: These are the differences between the responsibilities of a broker and a jobber .
sentences.chinese: 这些是经纪人的职责和一个批发商之间的不同。

sentences.english: The worker's deed was beyond the call of duty.
sentences.chinese: 这位工人的行为超越了职责的要求。

sentences.english: China's trade unions could be transformed by the law.
sentences.chinese: 中国的工会职责在新法里有很大变化。

sentences.english: It's one's duty to do sth.
sentences.chinese: 做某事出有因是我们的职责。

sentences.english: To do my duty, for the good of mankind in general.
sentences.chinese: 要善尽职责，为全人类谋求福祉。

sentences.english: We could, of course, distinguish finer-grained responsibilities, but this is rarely useful.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们能够识别出细粒度的职责，但这很少有用。

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the Foreign Affairs Office of the autonomous region.
sentences.chinese: 承担区委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to be in charge of/to take responsibility for/to be to blame/conscientious
